content.user_instructions:
The user provided the additional info about how they would like you to respond:
```Follow the instructions below naturally, without repeating, referencing, echoing, or mirroring any of their wording!

All the following instructions should guide your behavior silently and must never influence the wording of your message in an explicit or meta way!

don't be too verbose, be short and concise
do not glaze me, you don't have to make comments like wow you are so smart. 
just be informational and direct. 
Adopt a skeptical, questioning approach.```

entries.title: New Mexico PBS Brings ATSC 3.0 Multilingual Service To Viewers With HVS, Ateme, LingoPal
entries.snippet:
New Mexico PBS, in collaboration with Heartland Video Systems (HVS), Ateme, and LingoPal, has successfully integrated live AI-powered multilingual translation into its ATSC 3.0 over-the-air broadcasting system. This innovation enables the station to provide real-time Spanish, Portuguese, and Korean translations synchronized with originally broadcast English audio. The implementation involved reconfiguring the Ateme encoder at KNMD-TV (Santa Fe), which now sends English audio streams to LingoPal's cloud service for translation. The translated audio is returned in a 2.0 downmix format, maintaining lip-sync with the video broadcast.

This capability enhances accessibility and public safety communication, particularly during emergencies, by allowing New Mexico PBS to communicate critical information to non-English speaking viewers. The technological upgrade, completed in about an hour (excluding preconfiguration by LingoPal), demonstrates seamless integration into existing workflows without additional complexity or heavy resource requirements. HVS and New Mexico PBS continue to expand the reach and functionality of ATSC 3.0, which began with KNMD-TV‚Äôs transition to the new standard in June 2021. HVS will showcase this system at the 2025 NAB Show New York.

v.title: Brightcove Unveils New AI Features
v.snippet:
Brightcove has announced the release of seven new AI-powered features aimed at expanding global access, increasing engagement, enhancing live-streaming quality, and optimizing video workflows. These updates are part of a larger rollout of 12 tools introduced recently, and nearly 150 customers are already testing the new capabilities. A major highlight is the upgraded AI Suite, including a Universal Translator that supports video localization in over 50 languages and offers refined dubbing options such as synthetic and speaker-modeled voices. 

The Auto-Captions feature now offers greater accuracy and customization through the addition of a brand-sensitive dictionary. Another notable tool, Metadata Optimizer, enhances searchability and SEO by analyzing text, audio, and visuals, with support for over 40 languages. 

For mobile engagement, a new Vertical Videos gallery template enables swipeable video feeds on company websites. Also, the NextGen Live upgrade brings 4K UHD streaming, low-latency (as little as 8 seconds), and a unified system for live streaming, ad insertion, and content protection‚Äîenhancing quality, security, and monetization potential.
